dublin_core.dcvalue: Bayeck, R. Y. (2018). Learning with Songo: The African board game. In Kay, J. and Luckin, R. (Eds.) Rethinking Learning in the Digital Age: Making the Learning Sciences Count, 13th International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2018, Volume 3. London, UK: International Society of the Learning Sciences.

Studies of games show that they are useful spaces for understanding learning. This paper explored learning in the African Songo board game environment to understand how learning occurs through audience-player interactions. The study revealed that this space enhances collaborative and argumentative scaffolding, which calls for further exploration of this setting as the field rethinks learning in the digital age.
